content: chain into the chain not the chain space of the ch5 of the previous row main body of scarf begin with ch25 the first row is just single_crochet ch1 as a turning chain single_crochet in 2nd chain from the hook single_crochet in next chain to end 25 stitches turn now set up the filet mesh ch5 counts as double_crochet ch2 skip 3 single_crochet including the one the chain is coming out of double_crochet in next single_crochet then ch2 skip 2 single_crochet double_crochet in next single_crochet to end 25 stitches and 8 mesh squares turn continue in the filet mesh pattern above until the scarf is the length you like remembering that you will add a couple of inches to each end with the arches a typical indoor scarf is approximately 48 so you would continue the filet crochet for approximately 42 84 row in the worsted weight gauge above you might want a longer scarf if it is to fit around a coat collar finish with a row of single_crochet on all 25 stitches ch1 as a turning chain and then do your first single_crochet in the 1st double_crochet fasten_off arched border and edging you will complete the arched border on one end except for the last row of edging and fasten_off you will then repeat on the other end but instead of fastening off you will immediately start the edging and go all the way around the scarf including the arch on the other end see figure first arch reattach your yarn to the stitch that is three squares from the right edge on one end see figure row 1 skip 2 single_crochet double_crochet 7 times in next single_crochet the center stitch of the scarf skip 2 single_crochet slipstitch to next single_crochet three squares from the left edge slipstitch to next single_crochet 3 more times you should now be lined up with the next double_crochet from the mesh turn © proper trappings 2007 delicate arch crochet scarf page 2 of 2 row 2 double_crochet twice in next double_crochet 3 times double_crochet 3 times into next double_crochet the middle one double_crochet twice into next double_crochet 3 times slipstitch to 3rd single_crochet from where you attached your yarn two squares from the right edge slipstitch to next single_crochet 3 more times you should now be lined up with the next double_crochet from the mesh turn row 3 double_crochet in next double_crochet 7 times double_crochet twice in next double_crochet the middle one double_crochet in next double_crochet 7 times slipstitch to 3rd single_crochet from where you began the previous row one square from left edge slipstitch to next single_crochet 3 more times you should now be lined up with the last double_crochet on the left turn row 4 ch1 double_crochet in next double_crochet to end 16 times ch1 slipstitch to last single_crochet on the right fasten_off other arch reattach yarn and repeat row 1-4 as above but do not fasten_off turn row 5 the edging ch4 counts as single_crochet ch3 single_crochet in first
